title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
üéâWelcome to our wedding celebration websiteüéâ. It‚Äôs high time all our favorite people came to visit us in Madison, Wisconsin to celebrate and have some fun! We are excited to see you at our evening shindig on Saturday, October 4th, 2025 at the Warner Park Community Recreation Center on our beloved Northside Madison.
Please Note: We‚Äôve had to change both the date and location of our celebration (if you‚Äôre looking at the ‚ÄúSave the Date‚Äù). It was beyond us that we were playing with fire picking a date before the University of Wisconsin Madison football home game schedule was released ü¶°. October 18th will be a face-off with the Ohio State University at UW Madison‚Äôs Camp Randall Stadium, and hotels are already gone/insane. Hoping this doesn‚Äôt through a wrench in your plans!
If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at elise.hinman@gmail.com

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Will you join us?
The button below will take you to a Google Form to fill out. Immediate family member(s) are welcome and individual invitees may bring a plus one. Please RSVP by September 1st, 2025.

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Schedule

Friday, October 3rd
7:00 pm to 9:00 pm - Drinks and games at Aftershock Arcade (1444 E Washington Ave Madison, WI 53703). We‚Äôll supply each person with one drink and some arcade tokens! Note that children are not permitted after 7:00 pm at the arcade.


Saturday, October 4th
6:00 to 9:00 pm - Wedding celebration party at the Warner Park Community Recreation Center. Arrive for some happy hour drinks before dinner catered by Banzo. Be ready for lawn games, music, dancing, and more!



Devil‚Äôs Lake ferns

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Getting Here
Madison has its own airport, Dane County Regional Airport. There are few direct flights to/from Madison, but you might get lucky!
Another option is to fly into Chicago (O‚ÄôHare or Midway) and get a rental car. If you fly into O‚ÄôHare and do not want to rent a car, you can use the Van Galder bus to get between Madison and Chicago. Bus tickets are around $70 round trip per person.

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Lodging
There are many hotels on the east side of Madison that are within driving distance of the venue. Here are a few:
Hampton Inn Madison East: 4820 Hayes Rd, Madison, WI 53704
Holiday Inn Express and Suites: 5150 High Crossing Blvd, Madison, WI 53718
Cambria Hotel: 5045 Eastpark Blvd, Madison, WI, 53718
There are also many hotels to choose from on the isthmus (Downtown Madison) that tend to be pricier. However, many are in close proximity to the Metro bus D line, which takes you right up to Warner Park.

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Wedding celebration dress code
Dress is casual. Wear clothing that makes you feel good. It‚Äôs prudent to bring layers because early fall in Madison can be a bit variable, but we‚Äôll have ample indoor space in case the weather is cool/disagreeable. We will have yard games set up, so if you‚Äôd like to participate, wear clothes that are easy to move around in.



Devil‚Äôs Lake forest

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:

Thanks for considering contributing to our wedding registry! 

 Contribute to our canoe dreams

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Things to do
There‚Äôs a lot to do around Madison. Here are a few of our favorite spots to eat and hang out. If you find any new spots worth checking out, let us know!

Activities
Olbrich Botanical Gardens - Beautiful outdoor ornamental gardens that are free to the public. Or, if you‚Äôre looking for a tropical oasis, check out the Bolz Conservatory (tickets are $6, with free admission on Saturday 10:00 am to 12:00 pm).
University of Wisconsin Madison Arboretum - Sweeping open spaces representing a variety of native Wisconsin plant communities, in addition to curated horticultural collections.
Dane County Farmer‚Äôs Market - Expansive farmer‚Äôs market featuring Dane County-sourced fruits, vegetables, prepared food, and other wares. Runs from 6:15 am to 1:45 pm on Saturdays.
Northside Farmer‚Äôs Market - Sunday farmer‚Äôs market near our house! Much smaller, less crowded, delicious breakfast and lunch food.
Henry Vilas Zoo - What can we say, it‚Äôs a free-to-visit zoo in a quaint part of town!
Wisconsin State Capitol - Visit the location where we tied the knot: the Wisconsin State Capitol! It is beautiful inside, with gorgeous stonework, mosaics, and other exhibits.
Lakeshore Nature Preserve - An outdoor laboratory for UW Madison, the Lakeshore Nature Preserve has so many lovely views of Lake Mendota and various trails through diverse plant communities.
Wisconsin Memorial Union - The Memorial Union is a gathering place for the community. During pleasant weather, sit out on the Terrace, enjoy a beer, brat, ice cream cone (or all of the above!). It‚Äôs a relaxing spot to visit, but beware that parking can be tricky!
Madison Children‚Äôs Museum - Arts, crafts, things to climb on, rooftop gardens, and more. We went here with our nephews and had a good time as adults!
Garver Feed Mill - Large, restored brick building containing a collection of shops and places to eat. The Feed Mill often hosts craft fairs and other fun community events.
Monroe Street - Trendy walk with shops, bakeries, and restaurants.
A Room of One‚Äôs Own Bookstore - Lovely local bookstore with a diversity of book genres, cards, games, and other gifts.
Explore the neighborhoods - There are so many fun spots to walk and peruse in Madison. This link will take you to a page that explains what different neighborhoods are known for.


Eating
Mint Mark - New American small plates made with locally sourced ingredients. Really good mixed drinks ($$$).
Canteen - Cozy taco joint with delicious margaritas ($$).
Ahan - Amazing Laotian and Asian-inspired dishes with locally sourced ingredients. Like Mint Mark, the drinks are playful and fun to try ($$$).
Bandit Tacos - Tacos and coffee (and margs!) in an old train depot ($$).
Tip Top Tavern - Burgers, sandwiches, salads, and pub appetizers, along with traditional brunch food ($$).
Dexter‚Äôs Pub - Fun Wisconsin sports bar with delicious Friday Night Fish Fry ($$).
Molten Monkey - Detroit-style pies with a variety of adventurous flavors ($$).
Lola‚Äôs Hi-Lo Lounge - Walk into the doors of Lola‚Äôs on the Northside and be transported to another time. It‚Äôs like‚Ä¶a chic diner with nightly DJ‚Äôs that spin everything from jazz to punk to Motown ($$).
Ancora - Delicious spot for breakfast and lunch, with multiple locations across town ($).
There are so many more, we just don‚Äôt have the time or space to list them all.

title: Jay and Elise‚Äôs Wedding Party
text:
Backstory
NEWSFLASH: Jay and Elise married on Friday, October 11, 2024 at the Wisconsin State Capitol building, warmly surrounded by our families. It was a beautiful day that included fall color, declarations of love and commitment, lots of laughter, spicy margaritas, and delicious supper club food of course! It could not have been a better day to take this step in our relationship. What better way to draw out the celebration than to have our wedding party the following fall!?



Emmett, Jay, Elise, and Callie
